results.title: Tracker
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker and Kent Nason
results.brief_description: A view from the cockpit of a VS880 Tracker aircraft patrolling Atlantic coastal waters and the eastern Arctic from its base in Shearwater, Nova Scotia. The film is a demonstration of the kind of peacetime missions served by the air arm of the Canadian Armed Forces in protecting territorial waters against illegal incursion and pollution, and in safe-guarding national sovereignty.

results.title: Track stars: the unseen heroes of movie sound
results.creator_credit: Film Arts, Learning Corporation of America and Terry Burke
results.brief_description: Split-screen technique is used to demonstrate how “track stars” - movie sound specialists - painstakingly match sounds to the action of the characters who are being filmed.

results.title: Track and field for intermediate grades (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Dave Turkington
results.brief_description: Shows how track and field activities may be taught either in a gym or out-of-doors. Emphasises attentionto improving inexpensive indoor jumping pits, hurdles, and other indoor equipment.

results.title: Track 29
results.creator_credit: HandMade Films, Rick McCallum and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: This surreal, darkly comic psychological thriller stars Theresa Russell as a young woman, permanently scarred by a teenage rape, which resulted in a pregnancy and the forced removal of her baby. Obsessed by the loss of her child, and married to an equally, but differently obsessed doctor husband, (model trains and playfully masochistic sessions with his nurse), she is confronted one day by a mysterious stranger who claims to be her long-lost son. It seems he also has been obsessed with finding his mother, but at this point reality and fantasy become confused and a deadly and erotic game begins … Also stars Gary Oldman and Christopher Lloyd with Sandra Bernhardt in a cameo role. Dennis Potter wrote the script.
results.creator_credit_for_label: HandMade Films, Rick McCallum and Nicolas Roeg

results.title: Tracing the spread of infection
results.creator_credit: Nucleus Film Unit, British Ministry of Health, Jack Chambers and Michael Clarke
results.brief_description: Contains the only known film records of the phage typing test and the coagulose test. It demonstrates how these tests can be used to trace a strain of staphylococcus back to the source in a human carrier.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nucleus Film Unit, British Ministry of Health, Jack Chambers and Michael Clarke

results.title: Tracey Emin [Widescreen]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TheEYE”.
Part of a series of interview-based profiles of contemporary visual artists in Britain - this episode focuses on Tracey Emin whose intelligence, talent and finesse has at times been obscured by her infamy and the controversy that surrounds her highly personalised art. Many of her best-known works, including “Everyone I have ever slept with 1963-1995” (1995) and “My bed” (1998) are startlingly frank as they deal with the intrinsically personal themes in which she engages - autobiography, memory, desire and identity. Discussing her art, and the furore that has often surrounded it, Emin astutely addresses some of the criticisms that have been levelled at her, believing that a part of her success is attributable to timing - her yen for self-examination taps into the zeitgeist of the times when Britain is looking toward individualistic issues, which reflect the space that Emin effortlessly occupies. An illuminating interview with a focused, passionate and intriguing artist, this documentary also contains archival footage of Emin at work and features selections of her blankets, installations, neon art and drawings.

results.title: Tra
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Tra and his family and their fight for survival in post-war Vietnam. Before moving to the city Tra’s family were rice farmers but now they live in overcrowded conditions where malnutrition and disease are increasing
results.description: Tells the story of Tra and his family and their fight for survival in post-war Vietnam. Before moving to the city Tra’s family were rice farmers but now they live in overcrowded conditions where malnutrition and disease are increasing

results.title: Toys from Nuremberg
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the toy industry in Nuremberg. The first wooden toys were made 600 years ago, today automated precision machines produce 70% of the toys. The favourites of the 17th century were lead soldiers and doll’s houses, now it is electric trains and vacuum cleaners.

results.title: Toys
results.brief_description: It begins with the faces of children outside a toy store window at Christmas—but then the war toys appear and we realize that some games are played for keeps. This film has no commentary, but it is easy to see what it aims to show: war toys do not necessarily make warriors, but it is possible that they give a false glamor to the deadly pursuit. With toys that keep up with the times, this film creates a battle that is all too real and frightening.
